Enterprise Virtualization For six years, Larry Page and Sergey Brin told Eric Schmidt that Google should build its own browser, and for six years, he resisted. "Google was a small company," Eric Schmidt remembered. Having come through the bruising browser wars, I didn't want to do that again. So Sergey Brin and Page hired some ex-Firefox developers and had them build a prototype. When they showed Eric Schmidt the browser that would be Chrome, he relented.
